alert.note: Alert for Butler; Preble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 13 at 7:56PM EDT until June 13 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR BUTLER AND SOUTH CENTRAL PREBLE COUNTIES... At 756 PM EDT, radar indicated between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Thunderstorms have moved east of the area, but flash flooding may continue the next few hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Oxford, Monroe, Trenton, South Middletown, Ross, Seven Mile, Williamsdale, Darrtown, Reily, New Miami, Millville, Scipio, Somerville, Jacksonburg, Collinsville, Mcgonigle and Layhigh. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. To report flash flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
